Sentencas: Nanocrystalline hydroxyapatite, Ca-10(PO4)(6)(OH)(2) (HAp) is synthesized from hydroxide gels at room temperature using sonochemical technique.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: The as-synthesized material is characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), selected area electron diffraction (SAED), Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR), and solid-state (H-1 and P-31)
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone
Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: Hexagonal structure with space group P6(3)/m is evident from powder XRD.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: Microscopic analysis with SAED indicates the nanocrystalline nature of the compound.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: Average particle size of 30 nm with excellent phase purity in good stoichiometric ratios of HAp is observed.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: The prevalence of protons as hydroxyls in apatitic structure of HAp is evident from FTIR and solid-state NMR.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: The microstructure and proton conducting properties of the synthesized material are compared with the natural human bone powder having similar constituents.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Sentencas: The sonochemically prepared HAp, and HAp-Nafion (R) composite exhibited excellent AC conductivities similar to 10(-5) S cm(-1) at 650 degrees C and similar to 10(-5) S cm(-1) at 160 degrees C, respectively, may find application as an electrolyte for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs) and high temperature polymer electrolyte fuel cells (HT-PEFCs) applications.
Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone

Titulo: Structural and proton transport studies on nanocrystalline [Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2] (HAp), HAp-Nafion® composite, and natural human bone
